Protocols/WLDelegateSwift.html#/s:24IBMM.name: onSuccess(response:)
Protocols/WLDelegateSwift.html#/s:24IBMM.abstract: This method will be called if any kind of failure occurred during the execution.

Protocols/WLDelegateSwift.html#/s:24IBMM.name: onFailure(response:)
Protocols/WLDelegateSwift.html#/s:24IBMM.abstract: This method will be called if any kind of failure occurred during the execution.

Protocols/WLDelegateSwift.html.name: WLDelegateSwift
Protocols/WLDelegateSwift.html.abstract: A protocol that defines methods that a delegate should implement, to receive notifications about the success or failure of the method call.

Classes/WLSimpleDataSharingSwift.html#/s.name: setSharedToken(name:value:)
Classes/WLSimpleDataSharingSwift.html#/s.abstract: Saves a key,value pair to a shared credential storage available to a group of applications in the same family.

Classes/WLSimpleDataSharingSwift.html#/s.name: getSharedToken(name:)
Classes/WLSimpleDataSharingSwift.html#/s.abstract: Retrieves the value of a token in the shared credential storage.

Classes/WLSimpleDataSharingSwift.html#/s.name: clearSharedToken(name:)
Classes/WLSimpleDataSharingSwift.html#/s.abstract: Removes the token from shared credential storage.

Classes/WLSecurityUtilsSwift.html#/s:24I.name: generateKey(withPassword:andSalt:andIterations:)
Classes/WLSecurityUtilsSwift.html#/s:24I.abstract: Generates a key by using the PBKDF2 algorithm.

Classes/WLSecurityUtilsSwift.html#/s:24I.name: decrypt(withKey:andDictionary:)
Classes/WLSecurityUtilsSwift.html#/s:24I.abstract: Decrypts a dictionary that contains: src (source), v (version), ct (cipher text) and the iv (initialization vector).

Classes/WLSecurityUtilsSwift.html#/s:24I.name: getRandomStringFromServer(withBytes:timeout:onCompletion:)
Classes/WLSecurityUtilsSwift.html#/s:24I.abstract: Gets a random string from the server.

Classes/WLSecurityUtilsSwift.html#/s:24I.name: base64String(data:length:)
Classes/WLSecurityUtilsSwift.html#/s:24I.abstract: Encodes data to an NSString with Base64 encoding.

Classes/WLSecurityUtilsSwift.html#/s:24I.name: decodeBase64(withFiles:output:)
Classes/WLSecurityUtilsSwift.html#/s:24I.abstract: Reads Base64 encoded file and writes decoded output to output file

Classes/WLResponseSwift.html#/s:24IBMMob.name: status
Classes/WLResponseSwift.html#/s:24IBMMob.abstract: Retrieves the HTTP status from the response.

Classes/WLResponseSwift.html#/s:24IBMMob.name: invocationContext
Classes/WLResponseSwift.html#/s:24IBMMob.abstract: Invocation context object passed when calling invokeProcedure.

Classes/WLResponseSwift.html#/s:24IBMMob.name: responseJSON
Classes/WLResponseSwift.html#/s:24IBMMob.abstract: Returns the value Dictionary in case the response is a JSON response, otherwise it returns the value nil.

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: WLHttpMethodGet
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: GET constant for the request method

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: WLHttpMethodPost
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: POST constant for the request method

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: WLHttpMethodPut
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: PUT constant for the request method

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: WLHttpMethodDelete
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: DELETE constant for the request method

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: init(url:method:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Creates an instance of WLResourceRequestSwift with the specified URL and method

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: init(url:method:scope:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Creates an instance of WLResourceRequestSwift with the specified URL, method and scope

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: init(url:method:timeout:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Creates an instance of WLResourceRequestSwift with the specified URL, method and timeout

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: init(url:method:timeout:scope:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Creates an instance of WLResourceRequestSwift with the specified URL, method, timeout and scope.

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: setQueryParameterValue(parameterValue:forName:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Sets query parameter value

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: getQueryString()
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Returns the query parameters as string

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: headerNames()
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Returns header names as an array of strings

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: headers(forName:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Returns header name as an array of strings

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: header(forName:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Returns first header with matching name

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: setHeaderValue(value:forName:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Sets the header for the request

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: addHeaderValue(value:forName:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Adds the header to the request

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: removeHeaders(forName:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Removes the header from the request

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: send(onCompletion:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Sends a request and uses the closure callback to handle the response

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: send(withQueue:onCompletion:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Sends a request and uses the closure callback to handle the response.

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: send(withDelegate:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Sends a request and uses a delegate to handle the response

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: send(responseQueue:withDelegate:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Sends a request and uses a delegate to handle the response

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: send(withBody:onCompletion:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Sends a request with the provided text as a request body and uses a completionHandler block to handle the response

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: send(withBody:responseQueue:onCompletion:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Sends a request with the provided text as a request body and uses a completionHandler block to handle the response

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: send(withBody:delegate:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Sends a request with the provided text as a request body and uses a delegate to handle the response

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: send(withBody:responseQueue:delegate:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Sends a request with the provided text as a request body and uses a delegate to handle the response

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: send(withFormParameters:onCompletion:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Sends a request with form parameters as a request body and uses a closure block to handle the response

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: send(withFormParameters:responseQueue:onCompletion:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Sends a request with form parameters as a request body and uses a closure block to handle the response

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: send(withFormParameters:delegate:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Sends a request with form parameters as a request body and uses a delegate to handle the response

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: send(withFormParameters:responseQueue:delegate:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Sends a request with form parameters as a request body and uses a delegate to handle the response

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: send(withJSON:onCompletion:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Sends a request with the provided JSON and uses a closure block to handle the response

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: send(withJSON:responseQueue:onCompletion:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Sends a request with the provided JSON and uses a closure block to handle the response

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: send(withJSON:delegate:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Sends a request with the provided JSON and uses a delegate to handle the response

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: send(withJSON:responseQueue:delegate:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Sends a request with the provided JSON and uses a delegate to handle the response

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: send(withData:onCompletion:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Sends a request with the provided request data and uses a closure block to handle the response.

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: send(withData:responseQueue:onCompletion:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Sends a request with the provided request data and uses a closure block to handle the response.

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: send(withData:delegate:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Sends a request with the provided request data and uses a delegate to handle the response

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.name: send(withData:responseQueue:delegate:)
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html#/s:2.abstract: Sends a request with the provided request data and uses a delegate to handle the response

Classes/WLFailResponseSwift.html#/s:24IB.name: errorMsg
Classes/WLFailResponseSwift.html#/s:24IB.abstract: An error message for the developer, which is not necessarily suitable for displaying to the end user.

Classes/WLFailResponseSwift.html#/s:24IB.name: status
Classes/WLFailResponseSwift.html#/s:24IB.abstract: An error status code from the server

Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: sharedInstance()
Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: This method returns the shared instance of WLClientSwift.

Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: HTTPCookieStorage()
Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: Retrieves the shared cookie storage that is used by the framework when communicating with the server.

Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: send(request:delegate:)
Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: This method uses URLConnection to execute the provided URLRequest.

Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: send(request:responseQueue:delegate:)
Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: This method uses URLConnection to execute the provided URLRequest.

Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: registerChallengeHandler(challengeHandler:)
Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: You can use this method to register a challenge handler, which is a class that inherits either from GatewayChallengeHandlerSwift or SecurityCheckChallengeHandlerSwift.

Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: addGlobalHeader(headerName:headerValue:)
Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: You use this method to add a global header, which is sent on each request. Each WlRequest instance will use this header as an HTTP header.

Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: removeGlobalHeader(headerName:)
Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: You use this method to remove a global header, which is no longer sent with each request.

Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: setHeartBeatInterval(interval:)
Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: This method sets the interval, in seconds, at which the client (device) sends a heartbeat signal to the server.

Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: setServerUrl(url:)
Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: Sets the IBM MobileFirst Platform server URL to the specified URL.

Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: serverUrl()
Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: Returns the current IBM MobileFirst Platform server URL.

Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: pinTrustedCertificatePublicKey(certificateFilename:)
Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: Pins the host X509 certificate public key to the client application. Secured calls to the pinned remote host will be checked for a public key match. Secured calls to other hosts containing other certificates will be rejected. Some mobile operating systems might cache the certificate validation check results. Your app must call the certificate pinning method before making a secured request. Calling this method a second time overrides any previous pinning operation.

Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: pinTrustedCertificatePublicKey(certificateFilenames:)
Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: Pins a list of host X509 certificates with public key to the client application. Secured calls to the all pinned remote host will be checked for a public key match. Secured calls to other hosts containing other certificates not pinned with app will be rejected. Some mobile operating systems might cache the certificate validation check results. Your app must call the certificate pinning method before making a secured request. Calling this method a second time overrides any previous pinning operation.

Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: setDeviceDisplayName(displayName:onCompletion:)
Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: Sets the display name of the device. The display name is stored in the MobileFirst Server registration data.

Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: getDeviceDisplayName(onCompletion:)
Classes/WLClientSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: Gets the display name of the device. The display name is retrieved from the MobileFirst Server registration data.

Classes/WLAuthorizationManagerSwift.html.name: obtainAccessToken(forScope:onCompletion:)
Classes/WLAuthorizationManagerSwift.html.abstract: Obtains an access token for the specified MobileFirst protected resource scope.

Classes/WLAuthorizationManagerSwift.html.name: isGatewayResponse(response:)
Classes/WLAuthorizationManagerSwift.html.abstract: Check if the WLResponse contains a Gateway Challenge

Classes/WLAuthorizationManagerSwift.html.name: isAuthorizationRequired(response:)
Classes/WLAuthorizationManagerSwift.html.abstract: Checks if the response for a request to a MobileFirst protected resource indicates that authorization is required.

Classes/WLAuthorizationManagerSwift.html.name: isAuthorizationRequired(status:headers:)
Classes/WLAuthorizationManagerSwift.html.abstract: Checks whether the response is a MobileFirst OAuth error.

Classes/WLAuthorizationManagerSwift.html.name: resourceScope(fromResponse:)
Classes/WLAuthorizationManagerSwift.html.abstract: Returns the resource scope from a response for a request to a MobileFirst protected resource.

Classes/WLAuthorizationManagerSwift.html.name: clearAccessToken(accessToken:)
Classes/WLAuthorizationManagerSwift.html.abstract: Clears an invalid Access token from the WLAuthorizationManagerSwift cache

Classes/WLAuthorizationManagerSwift.html.name: setLoginTimeOut(timeOut:)
Classes/WLAuthorizationManagerSwift.html.abstract: Sets the authorization flow time out. if this value is not set by user, then deault 10s is considered as the default timeout

Classes/WLAuthorizationManagerSwift.html.name: resourceScope(responseHeaders:)
Classes/WLAuthorizationManagerSwift.html.abstract: Returns the resource scope from a response for a request to a MobileFirst protected resource.

Classes/WLAnalyticsSwift.html#/s:24IBMMo.name: sharedInstance()
Classes/WLAnalyticsSwift.html#/s:24IBMMo.abstract: Creates a shared instance to the WLAnalyticsSwift class.

Classes/WLAnalyticsSwift.html#/s:24IBMMo.name: addDeviceEventListener(deviceEvent:)
Classes/WLAnalyticsSwift.html#/s:24IBMMo.abstract: This method adds a DeviceEvent for Analytics to collect.

Classes/WLAnalyticsSwift.html#/s:24IBMMo.name: removeDeviceEventListener(deviceEvent:)
Classes/WLAnalyticsSwift.html#/s:24IBMMo.abstract: Disable analytics from collecting the specified DeviceEvent.

Classes/WLAnalyticsSwift.html#/s:24IBMMo.name: enbale()
Classes/WLAnalyticsSwift.html#/s:24IBMMo.abstract: This method enables capturing of analytics log data.

Classes/WLAnalyticsSwift.html#/s:24IBMMo.name: disable()
Classes/WLAnalyticsSwift.html#/s:24IBMMo.abstract: This method disables capturing of analytics log data.

Classes/WLAnalyticsSwift.html#/s:24IBMMo.name: send()
Classes/WLAnalyticsSwift.html#/s:24IBMMo.abstract: This method sends the log file when the log buffer exists and is not empty.

Classes/WLAnalyticsSwift.html#/s:24IBMMo.name: send(withDelegate:)
Classes/WLAnalyticsSwift.html#/s:24IBMMo.abstract: This method is the same as send, with the addition of a delegate that is notified when the send request succeeds or fails.

Classes/WLAnalyticsSwift.html#/s:24IBMMo.name: log(message:withMetadata:)
Classes/WLAnalyticsSwift.html#/s:24IBMMo.abstract: This method logs analytics data Some data is already captured by the framework. To avoid collisions, the following keys will be excluded if logged in the metadata: appID appLabel appVersion appVersionCode appName appVersion deviceBrand deviceOSversion deviceOS deviceModel deviceID timezone timestamp.

Classes/WLAnalyticsSwift.html#/s:24IBMMo.name: setUserContext(userContext:)
Classes/WLAnalyticsSwift.html#/s:24IBMMo.abstract: Specify current application user. If you want user-based analytics, you must use this method call. For example, use it when the user logs in, and call the unsetUserContext method when the user logs out. Or if your application supports user profiles, call this method when the user profile changes.

Classes/WLAnalyticsSwift.html#/s:24IBMMo.name: unsetUserContext()
Classes/WLAnalyticsSwift.html#/s:24IBMMo.abstract: Unset any user context previously set. Use this when user explicitly logs out or is no longer active.

Classes/SecurityCheckChallengeHandlerSwi.name: init(securityCheck:)
Classes/SecurityCheckChallengeHandlerSwi.abstract: Initializes a challenge handler with an arbitrary name.

Classes/SecurityCheckChallengeHandlerSwi.name: submitChallengeAnswer(answer:)
Classes/SecurityCheckChallengeHandlerSwi.abstract: Send the answer back to the request.

Classes/SecurityCheckChallengeHandlerSwi.name: handleChallenge(challengeResponse:)
Classes/SecurityCheckChallengeHandlerSwi.abstract: This method is called when the IBM MobileFirst Platform Server returns a challenge for the realm.

Classes/SecurityCheckChallengeHandlerSwi.name: handleSuccess(successResponse:)
Classes/SecurityCheckChallengeHandlerSwi.abstract: This method is called when the IBM MobileFirst Platform Server reports an authentication success.

Classes/SecurityCheckChallengeHandlerSwi.name: handleFailure(failureResponse:)
Classes/SecurityCheckChallengeHandlerSwi.abstract: This method is called when the IBM MobileFirst Platform Server reports an authentication failure.

Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: getInstanceWithPackage(package:)
Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: This method gets or creates an instance of this logger. If an instance exists for the package parameter, that instance is returned.

Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: send()
Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: This method sends the log file when the log buffer exists and is not empty.

Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: sendIfUnCaughtExceptionDetected()
Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: This method sends the log file when the log buffer exists, the log is not empty, and an uncaught exception occurred.

Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: getCapture()
Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: This method gets the current setting for determining if log data should be saved persistently.

Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: setCapture(flag:)
Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: Global setting: turn persisting of the log data that is passed to the log methods of this class, on or off.

Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: setShowLogsInConsole(flag:)
Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: Global setting: turn display of logs on log console , on or off.

Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: getFilters()
Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: This method will retrieve the filters that are used to determine which log messages are persisted.

Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: setFilters(filters:)
Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: This method sets the filters that are used to determine which log messages are persisted. Each key defines a package name and each value defines a logging level.

Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: getMaxFileSize()
Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: This method gets the current setting for the maximum file size threshold.

Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: setMaxFileSize(bytes:)
Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: This method sets the maximum size of the local log file. When the maximum file size is reached, no more data is appended. This file is sent to a server.

Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: getLevel()
Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: This method gets the current OCLogger_LEVEL and returns OCLogger_LEVEL.

Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: setLevel(level:)
Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: This method sets the level from which log messages must be saved and printed. For example, passing OCLogTypeSwift.OCLogger_INFO logs INFO.

Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: setAutoSendLogs(flag:)
Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: Global setting: Turns Auto Log Send on or off

Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: updateConfigFromServer()
Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: Get and apply the configuration from the IBM MobileFirst Platform Server. The configuration comes from the use of the Config Profiles tab in the IBM MobileFirst Platform administrative console. Note that this configuration will override the current configuration set on the device.

Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: isUnCaughtExceptionDetected()
Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: This method indicates that an uncaught exception was detected. The indicator is cleared on successful send.

Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.name: logWithLevel(withLevel:message:args:userInfo:)
Classes/OCLoggerSwift.html#/s:24IBMMobil.abstract: Logs a message at a specific OCLogTypeSwift log level with string replacement using arguments passed. This method also attaches a dictionary of user information to the log message that is available when logs are persisted and sent to the Analytics Server as custom analytics.

Classes/GatewayChallengeHandlerSwift.htm.name: init(gatewayName:)
Classes/GatewayChallengeHandlerSwift.htm.abstract: Initialize a challenge handler for the specific gateway.

Classes/GatewayChallengeHandlerSwift.htm.name: submitSuccess(response:)
Classes/GatewayChallengeHandlerSwift.htm.abstract: You must call this method when the challenge is answered successfully, for example after the user successfully submits the login form. Then, this method sends the original request. Calling this method informs IBM MobileFirst Platform that the challenge was successfully handled. This method can also be used to inform IBM MobileFirst Platform that the response that was received is not a custom response that your challenge handler can handle. In this case, control is returned to IBM MobileFirst Platform, to handle the response.

Classes/GatewayChallengeHandlerSwift.htm.name: canHandleResponse(response:)
Classes/GatewayChallengeHandlerSwift.htm.abstract: This method must be overridden by extending the GatewayChallengeHandler class. In most cases, you call this method to test whether there is a custom challenge to be handled in the response. If this method returns YES, IBM MobileFirst Platform calls the handleChallenge method.

Classes/GatewayChallengeHandlerSwift.htm.name: submitLoginForm(requestUrl:requestParameters:requestHeaders:requestTimeoutInMilliSeconds:requestMethod:)
Classes/GatewayChallengeHandlerSwift.htm.abstract: You use this method to send collected credentials to a specific URL. You can also specify request parameters, headers, and timeout.

Classes/GatewayChallengeHandlerSwift.htm.name: handleChallenge(response:)
Classes/GatewayChallengeHandlerSwift.htm.abstract: IBM MobileFirst Platform must call this method whenever isCustomResponse returns a YES value. You must implement this method. This method must handle the challenge, for example to show the login screen.

Classes/GatewayChallengeHandlerSwift.htm.name: onSuccess(successResponse:)
Classes/GatewayChallengeHandlerSwift.htm.abstract: This method is the success delegate for submitLoginForm

Classes/GatewayChallengeHandlerSwift.htm.name: onFailure(failureResponse:)
Classes/GatewayChallengeHandlerSwift.htm.abstract: This method is the failure delegate for submitLoginForm

Classes/BaseChallengeHandlerSwift.html#/.name: init(name:)
Classes/BaseChallengeHandlerSwift.html#/.abstract: Initializes a challenge handler with an arbitrary name.

Classes/BaseChallengeHandlerSwift.html#/.name: cancel()
Classes/BaseChallengeHandlerSwift.html#/.abstract: Cancels a challenge. This method informs MobileFirst Platform Foundation that the you do not intend to take any additional actions in an attempt to resolve the challenge. This method returns control to MobileFirst Platform Foundation for further handling. For example, call this method when the user clicks on a cancel button.

Classes/BaseChallengeHandlerSwift.html.name: BaseChallengeHandlerSwift
Classes/BaseChallengeHandlerSwift.html.abstract: BaseChallengeHandlerSwift is a base class for all challenge-handler classes.

Classes/GatewayChallengeHandlerSwift.htm.name: GatewayChallengeHandlerSwift
Classes/GatewayChallengeHandlerSwift.htm.abstract: You use this base class to create custom challenge handlers when using gateways. You must extend this class to implement your own challenge handler logic. You use this class to create custom user authentication with external gateways.

Classes/SecurityCheckChallengeHandlerSwi.name: SecurityCheckChallengeHandlerSwift
Classes/SecurityCheckChallengeHandlerSwi.abstract: You use this base class to create an IBM MobileFirst Platform challenge handler. You must extend this class to implement your own version of an IBM MobileFirst Platform challenge handler, for example RemoteDisableChallengeHandler.

Classes/WLAnalyticsSwift.html.name: WLAnalyticsSwift
Classes/WLAnalyticsSwift.html.abstract: Contains WLAnalyticsSwift methods that manage analytics logs.

Classes/WLAuthorizationManagerSwift.html.name: WLAuthorizationManagerSwift
Classes/WLAuthorizationManagerSwift.html.abstract: This class manages the OAuth interaction between the client and the authorization server

Classes/WLClientSwift.html.name: WLClientSwift
Classes/WLClientSwift.html.abstract: This singleton class exposes methods that you use to communicate with the IBM MobileFirst Platform Server.

Classes/WLFailResponseSwift.html.name: WLFailResponseSwift
Classes/WLFailResponseSwift.html.abstract: Contains error message, error code and status code that the server responds with

Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html.name: WLResourceRequestSwift
Classes/WLResourceRequestSwift.html.abstract: This class encapsulates a resource request. The resource may be an adapter on the MobileFirst server, or an external resource. The class provides several ‘send’ methods, with different inputs for the body of a request.

Classes/WLResponseSwift.html.name: WLResponseSwift
Classes/WLResponseSwift.html.abstract: Contains the response from the server like status, responseData

Classes/WLSimpleDataSharingSwift.html.name: WLSimpleDataSharingSwift
Classes/WLSimpleDataSharingSwift.html.abstract: Contains Simple Data Sharing methods to share tokens across a group of applications.
